reasoning: Early-onset macular degeneration (onset before age 60) measured as prevalence. Estimated at 8.5 per 100k based on population-based vision studies and clinic registries. Prevalence metric appropriate for chronic degenerative condition. Lower confidence due to variability in early-onset definition and limited epidemiological studies specifically focused on early-onset cases.
source: Friedman DS et al. (2004). Prevalence of age-related macular degeneration in the United States. Arch Ophthalmol. 122(4):564-572
